intro: Eustachys distichophylla, commonly known as the two-ranked sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves arranged in two ranks, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in wet or moist soils, often in marshy areas or along waterways. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
